alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 2:39AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In Southwest Ohio, Butler, Hamilton and Warren Counties. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 AM EDT, Radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the last 6 hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - The area has already received 1 to 2 inches of rainfall over the past 24 hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin and Springdale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
